alert.note: Alert for Gray (Texas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued May 17 at 6:01PM CDT by NWS Amarillo
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of southwestern Gray County through 630 PM CDT... At 600 PM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm 8 miles southeast of Kingsmill, or 11 miles south of Pampa, moving east at 10 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts of 50 to 55 mph and nickel size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. This storm will remain over mainly rural areas of southwestern Gray County. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.88 IN MAX WIND GUST...55 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.
